title: Fatboy Slim's Secret Song Gets a Yes After 25 Years
summary: A famous DJ named Fatboy Slim made a cool song 25 years ago by using a small part of music from the Rolling Stones' hit 'Satisfaction'. He called it 'Satisfaction Skank' and played it at his concerts as a special surprise. For many years, the Rolling Stones said no to letting him sell the song because they own the original music. But now, after 25 years, they have finally said yes! This means people can buy and listen to the song legally. The Rolling Stones even helped by giving Fatboy Slim their original recordings to make the song sound better. This shows that the band is now more open to letting others use their music in new ways.

background_read: Music sampling is when artists take a small part of a song and use it in their own music. Sometimes, they need permission from the original artist to do this. The Rolling Stones are a very famous band from the 1960s, and Fatboy Slim is a DJ known for fun dance music. This story is about how they worked together after a long time.
Article_Structure: WHO: Fatboy Slim and the Rolling Stones
WHAT: A song called 'Satisfaction Skank' is now allowed to be sold after 25 years
WHERE: In the music world, especially at concerts and online
WHY: Because the Rolling Stones changed their mind and became more open to sharing their music

perspectives.description: Fatboy Slim used sampling to create new music, showing how artists can build on old songs.
